page.title: 02HOUSING WELBURY
page.content: Welbury is a small linear village with a good variation of old & new houses. Many of the older houses are from local brick with pan-tiled roofs.The former Rectory,next to the church,is now a private house and dates from the early 19th.century.There is a row of old cottages built in the early 18th. century and recently renovated, facing the new Springhill estate of 24 modern, stone built houses.These houses were bought when new in 1968/69 for approx.Â£8,000 and today sell for around Â£65,000.Three farms lie within the village boundary. Applegarth Manor was built in the 1890's by the Merryweather family,but has been owned by the Sadler family for many years. The "Duke of Wellington" still operates as a public house with living accommodation,plus shop and cottage.
